title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 16 March - BBC News
summary: national park bids to protect paths .
thakor banned for six months by ecb .

documents.title: leicester city 1-2 chelsea ( aet )

author: Phil McNulty
Chief football writer

documents.title: derby county p-p cardiff city
text: derby county p-p cardiff city

documents.title: film of assault death woman incident
text: film of assault death woman incident

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live coverage for the week has now ended .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 on monday morning .

documents.title: labour mps backing pm over russia 'baying for blood '
text: chris williamson has said labour mps who have not backed jeremy corbyn 's response to the nerve agent attack deserve to be deselected .
mr williamson , the member for derby north and an ally of the labour leader , said mps who backed theresa may were `` baying for blood '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: ken clarke : 'russia behind nerve agent attack '
text: a senior conservative mp has said he has `` no doubt '' that russia is behind the poisoning of a former spy and his daughter .
sergei skripal , 66 , and yulia skripal , 33 , remain critically ill in hospital , after they were found unconscious on a bench in salisbury on 4 march .
`` i have no doubt it is the russians , '' rushcliffe mp ken clarke told bbc radio nottingham .
`` this was designed i think to send a little message to ex-patriot russians wherever they may be , that they would not be forgiven if they upset the kremlin too much . ''
russia denies involvement in the nerve agent attack .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: arrest following clumber park vandalism
text: a man has been arrested after clumber park was vandalised on two separate occasions .
police were called to the national trust-owned site on saturday 3 march after the 250-year-old bridge was badly damaged .
officers were also called out in the early hours of last monday after one of the buildings on the park was set alight .
a 27-year-old man has been arrested on sus of criminal damage , theft of a vehicle and arson with intent to endanger life .
he has been released on police bail .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: mariam moustafa death : 'no contact ' with teen on bus
text: bosses at nottingham city transport have released a statement following the death of 18-year-old student mariam moustafa .
ms moustafa died three weeks after being attacked outside the victoria centre .
footage has since emerged of the egyptian engineering student on board a bus .
as this is an ongoing police investigation , the information we can disclose about what happens on the bus is limited .

however , we can confirm that mariam does not inform the driver of any concerns she may have about other people in the queue for the bus , but when he subsequently hears raised voices on the top deck , our driver immediately attends to the problem and we can confirm there is no physical contact between mariam and anyone else on our vehicle . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: reports of shot fired in carlton
text: armed officers were sent to carlton after reports of a gun being fired .
part of forester grove was cordoned off after police were called to the street shortly after 13:00 .
there are no reports of injuries .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: warnock 'the standout manager ' - rowett
text: warnock 'the standout manager ' - rowett

documents.title: mariam moustafa : johnson reassures egypt over probe
text: foreign secretary boris johnson tweets
deeply saddened by the death of egyptian national mariam moustafa in the uk .
my condolences to mariam 's loved ones .
i have assured egyptian foreign minister shoukry that nottinghamshire police are investigating the case .
this death is a product of your ridiculous brexit and foreign policy .
resign at once
we know boris wo n't do that , he cares about his career more than goodness and truth .
she was killed by racist blacks .

hypocritical words/empty statements from the 'politician ' who recites colonial poems in myanmar temple , calls papuan `` cannibals '' , africans 'watermelon smiles ' and slam the doors on migrants ' faces .
hypocrite !

drew , just write to melanie shaw a4136de , hmp styal , wilmslow , cheshire , sk9 4hr .
you must put her a4136de number after name .

pls remember staff read letters in and out .
keep it light+ pleasant .

we 're very sad to hear this story .

انتم شعوب عنصرية تدعون الانسانية وانتم لا تعرفون عنها شئ ، ترون انفسكم دائما افضل شعوب الارض ، والجزمة اللى كانت لابساها مريم أشرف منكم ومن عنصريتكم

the hospital resigns the girl for a slight head injury .

the police says that it will take into account the motive of a hate crime , the bus driver called the ambulance and the police did n't come well i feel like saying that there in nottingham they have big problems to solve .

because @ twitterid and his friends have decided that poor people do n't deserve doctors , or nurses , or police or anything really .

please dont make this disgraceful incident political
i 'm not bothered about the political side !
i just want justice for mariam .
the fact is it 's only become big news because the family have pushed for it .
that 's how it works really .

i was n't even thinking politically when i sent that tweet .
i knew mariam and was ( am ) very angry and upset .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed for 15 years for abusing boys
text: a man who sexually abused two children when he was a teenager has been jailed .
keith chapman ( 40 , was sentenced for 15 sexual offences following a trial at nottingham crown court .
he had pleaded guilty in january to four counts of possession of indecent images .
chapman , who on one occasion paid the boys he abused £ 1 , was given a jail term totaling 15 years .
police said his assaults took place in the mansfield area in the late 1980s and mid-1990s .
det sgt fearne murdoch said : `` chapman systematically groomed and abused a young boy and got him to recruit a friend who was of the same age .
`` he committed the most serious and disturbing acts against them which have had a profound affect on them throughout their life . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: thakor banned for six months by ecb
text: thakor banned for six months by ecb

documents.title: karanka certain of marinakis backing
text: karanka certain of marinakis backing

documents.title: st patrick 's day stage event called off
text: organisers of the st patrick 's day celebrations in nottingham have been forced to cancel the live stage entertainment .
the team behind the event said the decision was due to adverse weather predictions and stressed the call had `` not been made lightly '' .
the parade is still going ahead and there will also be a stall selling shamrock and irish food , organisers added .
important information about tomorrows events
absolutely the right decision .
staging & winds just do not mix well .
well done for confirming in plenty of time .
have a great day every one regardless of any adverse weather .
shared .
have a great day regardless .
thanks for understanding alan .
the same press release also went out on facebook where people were a lot less understanding with their comments .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: amber warning for snow issued across east midlands
text: an amber weather warning for snow and ice across the east midlands has been issued by the met office .
it comes into effect from 16:00 on saturday and remains valid until 09:00 on sunday morning .
a less serious yellow warning is in place for the north of the region ( including chesterfield and mansfield ) this evening .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: family tributes to shop blast victims
text: family tributes to shop blast victims

documents.title: rugby : green and whites back in league action
text: nottingham will be looking to avenge three losses to bedford this season , when they host the blues at lady bay on sunday .
bristol-bound tiff eden ( starts at fly-half after being rested for the british and irish cup dead rubber against ospreys last weekend .
darryl veedenhaal , oliver evans and sean scanlon also return to the back division .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: five-year-old gets award for 999 call
text: a five-year-old who called 999 when his mum collapsed at home has been presented with an award .
george mart , from belper , up the phone when his mother became unconscious and collapsed onto the floor .
he answered the call handler 's questions and also looked after his two-year-old sister before help arrived .
leanne mart paid tribute to her son : `` george knows to call 999 if mummy is poorly , and he was so good on the phone .
`` i am so proud of him . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: bid to tidy up roadside
text: a council has organised a four-day litter in order to tidy up the verges of a busy a road .
from monday evening , a team will be making their way along the side of the a38 from the little eaton island to up rubbish .
councillor asaf afzal , from derby city council , said : `` we want the areas surrounding our roads to be as as possible , which means removing abandoned cans , bottle , and packaging . ''
the authority is warning drivers that there will be some partial road closures between 22:00-06:00 between monday 19 and friday 23 march .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: hundreds of students hit by loan error
text: hundreds of students hit by loan error

documents.title: infected dog 's heart cake wins baking contest
text: about to have your lunch ?
look away now .
student vets have won a cake competition with this unusual creation .
it 's a gory representation of a dog 's heart infected by a parasite and it 's meant to make you think about getting your pets wormed .
last year the competition at the university of nottingham 's sutton bonington campus was won by a similarly unappetising cake inspired by a canine infection of the uterus .
however , there were more appealing entries , worthy of bake off 's showstoppers category , included a tribute to sir david attenborough 's blue planet and pixar fishes , nemo and dory .
the contest held yesterday raised £ 880 for vets in the community and the terence higgins trust .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: new released in rape appeal
text: police have released updated of people they 'd like to speak to in connection with a rape and attempted murder last year .
warning : third party content may contain ads
a woman was forced to the ground , throttled unconscious and raped by a man in queens avenue , ilkeston , in the early hours of 26 november .
derbyshire police said they would like anyone who recognises themselves or anyone they know in this slideshow to get in touch .
they would also like to speak to anyone that was on the two bus to ilkeston which left nottingham about 03:15 that morning and arrived at 03:40 .
a reward of £ 10,000 has been offered by crimestoppers in connection with the investigation .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: gritters out tonight
text: we may be technically just days away from spring but temperatures are set to drop below zero tonight .
there 's an amber warning in place for snow and ice for much of the east midlands tomorrow from 16:00 to sunday morning .
gritting tonight .
more info : # grittertwitter # keepnottinghammoving
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: rams fan 'will still travel to world cup '
text: a football supporter has said he would be `` very surprised '' if lots of england fans decided not to go to this summer 's world cup in russia .
some mps have called on england to boycott the event , amid escalating tension between the two countries following the poisoning of a former russian spy .
garford beck , a lifelong derby county fan who also follows the national team around the world , said : `` i do n't think many will decide not to go .
`` most people 's plans are at an advanced stage , most of us have been booking flights since the draw was made in december .
`` you know , it [ the poisoning ] may influence one or two people but i would be very surprised if many people decide on that course of action . ''
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: 'inspiring ' cathedral gate designer gets honour
text: a blue plaque to commemorate an `` inspiring '' ironsmith has been unveiled .
robert bakewell , who set up a workshop on st peter 's street in derby , has been honored there .
his work includes the iron gates at derby cathedral and at the silk mill .
alex rock , who works at the cathedral , said he could not believe that it had taken so long for the uttoxeter-born ironsmith to be celebrated in this way .
`` robert bakewell 's story can inspire present and future creatives , '' mr rock said .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: mariam moustafa : pictures emerge of hospital treatment
text: the family of a student who died three weeks after being attacked outside the victoria centre have released photos taken during her hospital treatment .
egyptian national mariam moustafa , 18 , passed away on wednesday after the attack in nottingham on 20 february .
a 17-year-old girl was arrested on sus of assault occasioning grievous bodily harm and released on conditional bail .
police said they were keeping an `` open mind '' about whether the attack on miss moustafa , which has sparked outrage in egypt , was racially motivated .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: closing speeches in murder trial
text: the jury in the trial of a man accused of raping and murdering a 72-year-old woman in leicestershire has been hearing the closing speeches .
jane hings was found dead in her bungalow in elizabeth road in fleckney on 24 september .
the defendant , 26-year-old craig keogh , is also accused of burgling ms hings .
he 's not given evidence in the trail , but told police that the sex was consensual and ms hings was alive when he left her home .
he denies all of the charges

documents.title: pongy prawns distract theatregoers
text: pongy prawns distract theatregoers

documents.title: national park bidding to protect 'popular ' paths
text: keen ramblers have been learning about the upkeep of the peak district , as part of a fundraising campaign to protect footpaths .
the park wants to raise £ 140,000 to fund path repairs on the great ridge , between mam tor and lose hill near castleton in high peak .
`` popular paths become worn quickly and the weather can reduce a good path to a boggy mess very quickly , '' mike rhodes from the park said .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: road set for rush hour closure
text: one lane of a road near nottingham railway station will be closed for a day in order to connect a new water pipe .
canal street , heading towards london road will be shut from the afternoon of sunday 18 march until after lunch on monday 19 march .
nottingham city council is advising drivers to leave extra time for their commute .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: wet and dry east midlands
text: these snowdrops got a drenching in last night 's rain in heanor , derbyshire .
the grey clouds were breaking up a bit over birstall , leicestershire .
but there were blue skies in arnold , nottinghamshire .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: taylor expects more to take hales ' path
text: taylor expects more to take hales ' path

documents.title: melton couple on bargain hunt
text: a couple from melton are featured on bbc television 's bargain hunt today !
hugh and rita o'brien filmed the episode of the antiques show last year at southwell racecourse , with the auction stage taking place in lincoln in september .
they teamed up with expert gary pe and met presenter eric knowles during the filming for the bbc one programme .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: is this britain 's biggest lamb ?
text: this super-sized newborn , named billy , tips the scales at 24.7lb , around three times the size of a normal lamb .
he was born this week on a farm in upper broughton and is believed to be one of the uk 's biggest .
the head and the foot came out and i thought , i 've got problems here .
i 've not seen such a big one , so maybe it 's the food , maybe it 's the way we look after them ! ''
author: Matt Smith
BBC Radio Leicester Breakfast Show producer

documents.title: boxing legends unite to help ex-pro
text: boxing legends frank bruno and johnny nelson will be in nottingham at the weekend to help raise funds for herol 'bomber ' graham .
graham , who is arguably the best british boxer never to have won a world title , has been admitted to hospital .
bruno and nelson will be joining others in a 24-hour skipathon at the nottingham school of boxing .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed for raping teenager
text: a man has been jailed for nine years for raping a 15-year-old girl in leicester .
muhammed umar , 23 , of no fixed address , approached the teenager as she walked along narborough road at about 23:30 on 24 august last year .
he threatened her , lured her down an alleyway , and committed the attack on a mattress that he 'd been using to sleep rough .
umar was later identified through a dna match and an identity parade .
the victim has shown great strength throughout the investigation and the court case , which has been key in bringing the offender to court .
hopefully , the sentence will offer some closure and allow her to move forward . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: mansfield house death 'not sus
text: the death of a man at a property in mansfield is not being treated as sus
east midlands ambulance service attended the address in clumber drive at around 17:40 on tuesday following a report that a 41-year-old was unresponsive .
he was confirmed dead at the scene .
author: Kevin Stanley
BBC Radio Nottingham newsreader

documents.title: attack on egyptian teen footage emerges
text: attack on egyptian teen footage emerges

documents.title: tomb raider game developers return to derby
text: some of the team who designed the original tomb raider game series are in derby tonight ahead of the screening of the new film .
the character was created by games development company core which was based in ashbourne road , derby .

heather stevens was involved in its development , she said she could tell the game was going to be `` special '' while it was being created , but had no idea it would turn into the franchise that it has done .
she added : `` as a games designer you 're happy to be involved in a number one game it broke the mould in terms of the extras you would find in a game . ''
the developers will be answering questions at the quad before the film - which was released this week - is show .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: cash boost to promote market towns to german visitors
text: a campaign has been launched to try and attract more german tourists to newark and southwell .
discover england is spending £ 1m creating a 300-mile touring route along the a1 , between london and northumberland , stopping at the two towns .
the group are planning on promoting the route to german markets because touring holidays are popular there .

councillor david lloyd , from the district council , said : `` we welcome the opportunity to work in partnership with colleagues and make it easier for people to plan and book a trip to eastern england .
`` our district has so much to offer the international visitor and we look forward to the forthcoming developments . ''
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: forest goalkeeper joins salford on loan
text: salford city tweets
goalkeeper tim erlandsson has joined the club on a month 's loan from championship side nottingham forest welcome to the club , tim !
read more here
we will have more from tim after his first training session this morning !
keep an eye out at lunchtime
@ twitterid what 's that now , 50th signing of the season ?
living the the dream # reallifefootiemanager

all the best , tim .

weather that we 're due to get shortly .
he 's played for barrow before so he 's used to the artic conditions
being a forest fan in manchester- 1 .

author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: big nottingham wins for cross & smith
text: big nottingham wins for cross & smith

documents.title: delays across east midlands trains services today
text: various routes have been affected today after east midlands trains announced that a number of trains needed `` essential maintenance '' overnight .
the following services have no trains running today :
there are also a number of routes that have reduced coaches compared to normal :
the company has apologised for any problems caused and said it is working hard to prevent this from happening in the future .
anyone who suffered delays over 30 minutes may get compensation , the firm added .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: police helicopter response times increasing
text: the time it takes for derbyshire police to reach an incident has increased , now that it has to share an aircraft with other forces .
a report from derbyshire police says that from the start of this year , the average time for a helicopter to get to a scene in derbyshire is just over 38 minutes .
with the possibility of it taking longer to reach officers , managers are less likely to use one .

despite the number of operational aircraft on the decline nationally , the demand is still high , meaning derbyshire police are looking into other options , such as using drones to look for missing people .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: market harborough one of the best places to live
text: market harborough is the seventh-best place to live in the midlands , according to the sunday times .
the newspaper has just published its annual list of the most desirable places to live in the country .
it looks at a number of factors , from jobs , schools and broadband speed to culture and community spirit .
shipston-on-stour in warwickshire came out on top for the midlands .
author: Christian Hill
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: mountsorrel parish council hikes tax precept by 162 %
text: people in mountsorrel have been left shocked after the parish council hiked its precept on the council tax bill by 162 % .
the rise will see residents of band d properties paying £ 199.85 a year towards the parish council 's part of the bill in 2018/19 , compared to the £ 75 they were charged in 2017/18 .

mountsorrel parish council blamed central and local government cuts for the huge increase , and said the running of services such as the library and the new mountsorrel memorial centre had contributed to the rise .
the total council tax bill for band d residents in mountsorrel is £ 1620.17
author: Namrata Varia
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: homeless charity celebrates 135 years
text: the y in leicester is celebrating 135 years of offering support to homeless people in leicester .
opened in 1883 by mr thomas lloyd the aim was to 'promote the welfare of young men in every possible way ' .
leicester ymca offered many clubs , from literacy and debating and much more .
after 135 years , and the only way lloyd 's dream has changed , is that the y ( ymca leicester ) now promotes the welfare of all young people , not just the welfare of young men .
a celebration service at leicester cathedral will take place on sunday .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: fancy running a bookshop on your holiday ?
text: here 's a novel idea
author: Alex Thorp
BBC News

documents.title: mp backs derby venue refurb
text: the culture secretary has said derby 's assembly rooms should be refurbished instead of being knocked down .
matt hancock made a surprise visit to the venue , which has now been closed for four years after a fire .
labour , which runs derby city council , wants to build a brand new assembly rooms .
derby 's conservatives say they 'd reopen the existing venue , using £ 10m of government money already committed to it .
now , a senior member of the government has backed their plan .
`` it 's in good nick you can see there 's a brand new acoustic ceiling in the main area , '' mr hancock said .
`` and i think the plans to refurb and reopen it look exciting . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: rutland ospreys return
text: the first pair of ospreys are back at rutland water .
the female maya arrived on monday and her mate 33 arrived yesterday .
this is the earliest they have ever returned .
you can see the breeding pair at the lyndon nature reserve .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: mariam moustafa : 'vital warnings missed '
text: the family of an egyptian teenager who died after she was attacked by a group in nottingham have said her death could have been prevented if police acted on an earlier incident .
mariam moustafa , 18 , died on wednesday three weeks after the attack .
her family claim an attack by the same group of people in august - which left mariam injured and her teenage sister with a broken leg - was not sufficiently investigated by police .
malak moustafa , 16 , told the times newspaper : `` no-one did anything , something could 've been done , and if the police did then she would still be here .
`` i do think vital warnings were missed , the police should 've done something after the first attack , but they did nothing .
a complaint was filed and that was it . ''
nottinghamshire police said they are aware of social media posts claiming the attack was motivated by hate and are `` keeping an open mind '' .
a 17-year-old girl has been arrested on sus of assault occasioning grievous bodily harm and was subsequently released on conditional bail .
author: Press Association

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: could there be more snow on the way ?
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: happy friday and welcome to our updates from across the east midlands .
calum mckenzie and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News
